ygData.subject: Re: "failed" digital output experiment
ygData.msgSnippet: Colin, Thanks for the write-up... interesting ideas! Do you know if anyone has added phasing or de-complexification mutation code to JNEAT? and is it

Colin,
Thanks for the write-up... interesting ideas!

Do you know if anyone has added "phasing" or de-complexification 
mutation code to JNEAT? and is it available?  I'd like to try it with 
the digital output experiment.

Karl


--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:
> Hi Karl,
> 
> Your diagram looks OK here BTW :)
> 
> The problem domain you describe is very similar to the Simple-OCR 
> experiment in SharpNEAT, which just happens to be the experiment 
used in 
> my recent phased search write-up. I also observed poor results, 
although 
> the OCR domain has a lot more input and output nodes than your 
digital 
> display domain.
> 
> Anyway, I raised a number of issues in the write-up which I can't 
really 
> do justice here so I would recommend you have a read and see what 
you 
> think. From my experiments with Simple-OCR and knowing that your 
digital 
> display domain problem has far fewer inputs and ouptuts, I am 
fairly 
> confident that this could be solved in SharpNEAT in it's current 
state. 
> I am willing to implement it and make another release if there are 
any 
> doubters :)
> 
> Oh the URL for the write-up is 
www.cgreen.dsl.pipex.com/phasedsearch.htm
> 
> Colin.
